Believe you can and you're halfway there. - Theodore Roosevelt
The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take. - Wayne Gretzky
Keep going; every step counts! - Unknown
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. - Paul (Romans 12:21, KJV)
He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command. - Niccolò Machiavelli
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are. - Theodore Roosevelt
It is not titles that honor men, but men that honor titles. - Niccolò Machiavelli
I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work. - Thomas Edison
If you're going through hell, keep going. - Winston Churchill
The best way to predict the future is to create it. - Abraham Lincoln
Hard work beats talent when talent doesn’t work hard. - Tim Notke
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit. - Aristotle
Pain is temporary, quitting lasts forever. - Lance Armstrong
It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up. - Vince Lombardi
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones. - Confucius
Your excuses will never be as good as someone else’s commitment. - David Goggins
Don’t count the days, make the days count. - Muhammad Ali
Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you. - Deuteronomy 31:6
You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them. - Michael Jordan
I hated every minute of training, but I said, ‘Don’t quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.’ - Muhammad Ali
Tough times don’t last, tough people do. - Robert H. Schuller
If you’re afraid of failing, you won’t get very far. - Kobe Bryant
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. - Confucius
Champions behave like champions before they’re champions. - Bill Walsh
A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way. - John C. Maxwell
He who opens a school door, closes a prison. - Victor Hugo
A quitter never wins, and a winner never quits. - Napoleon Hill
Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle. - Plato
You will never always be motivated, so you must learn to be disciplined. - David Goggins
Fall seven times and stand up eight. - Japanese Proverb
For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief. - Proverbs 24:16 (KJV)
The more you sweat in practice, the less you bleed in battle. - Richard Marcinko
Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will. - Suzy Kassem
A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool. - William Shakespeare
Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you. - Walt Whitman
He conquers who endures. - Persius
Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today. - Will Rogers
Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does. - William James
We cannot become what we need to be by remaining what we are. - John C. Maxwell
It always seems impossible until it’s done. - Nelson Mandela
Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life. - Steve Jobs
The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have. - Vince Lombardi
To know oneself is the beginning of all wisdom. - Aristotle
A thousand-mile journey begins with a single step. - Lao Tzu
Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. - Sam Levenson
In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity. - Albert Einstein
In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world. - Jesus Christ (John 16:33, KJV)
Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together. - Vincent Van Gogh
A dream does not become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination, and hard work. - Colin Powell
Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom. - George S. Patton
You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have. - Maya Angelou
Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value. - Albert Einstein
Do what you feel in your heart to be right—for you'll be criticized anyway. - Eleanor Roosevelt
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor. - Elon Musk
Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right. - Henry Ford
Opportunities don’t happen. You create them. - Chris Grosser
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear—not absence of fear. - Mark Twain
Work like hell. I mean, you just have to put in 80 to 100 hour weeks every week. This improves the odds of success. - Elon Musk
The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph. - George Washington
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus. - Bruce Lee
You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great. - Zig Ziglar
There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing. - Aristotle
Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence. - Vince Lombardi
Winners never quit, and quitters never win. - Vince Lombardi
You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. - Marcus Aurelius
